post.body: I worked in IT at the time supporting them. We used to joke that "yes indeed they were rocket scientists" when they called
used to work at Honeywell in the division where the space station and shuttle components were made. amazing place to work
love the color coding on your map. that helps the visual organizers like me. thanks for the sample
respoding to your post of Dec 2nd. I'm working with a non-profit that will be using Second Life as a train-the-trainer venue.
thanks man! I owe you a phone call to chat about SL . I've been on vacation the past two weeks or so. Havent forgotten ya.
being a visual thinker i love mind maps. I learn so much better when i can store it as a visual representation somehow.
#lrn09 Some of the other classes are Facilitation in SL, Designing Learning for SL, etc... that kind of thing. Corp and Edu folks.
#lrn09 Am working on '09 class dates. Next one will be end of Jan. its a 2.5 hour class held in SL. Will announce via twitter.
#lrn09 congrats to you! youtube vid and all. I will definitely check it out. keep on innovating!
hey man. how are you doin? Was good to meet you at the ASU Panel we did recently. I had heard your name but never face to face
is that a public link to the intro to SL? I run a hands-on orientation class in SL. Always seeking new tips
love the palette. Classy look, very nice. I'm an AZ guy so I'm glad to see our newsfolks online here.
thanks for following. I remember you from my storyteller.net days. Great to see you here and so active!
Diane! Been a long time. I see you've been busy with your new book "The Cajun Cornbread Boy". So proud of your success!
congrats on the Pagerank for your blog!
listening to interview w/Jim. Great stuff. Now listening to the end with you typing away not talking. lol.
Sure I'm interested Axel. Tell me more. Anything that drives exciting new ideas amongst our peers I'm in.
Excellent. What are you working on? What has you excited at this moment to bring to '09 in the learning field?
Learning leaders. Let's use #LRN09 in our tweets to start to thread our tweets together. post your ideas your passions about learning in 09
#LRN09
